name: Head
awareness: pressure (questions / inspiration); not an awareness center itself
biological_themes: Pineal / crown correspondence (inspirational input, ‘light’ into the system)
Upper endocrine relay to Ajna (pressure → conceptualization)

fears.label: Fear of unanswered questions
fears.description: Mental restlessness that insists every question must be resolved.

fears.label: Fear of meaninglessness / mystery
fears.description: Tension around what can’t be proved or known but keeps pressuring awareness.

fears.label: Fear of chronic mental stress
fears.description: Worry that thinking will never stop or that there’s ‘too much to know.’

gates.name: 63 — After Completion (Doubt)
gates.pressure_theme: Pressure to question logically and test what is claimed.
gates.notes: This is the logical questioner. It sends doubt to the Ajna (Gate 4) to produce answers. Not-self gets stuck doubting everything, including itself.
sources: Jovian Archive – Head Center / logic stream

gates.name: 64 — Before Completion (Confusion)
gates.pressure_theme: Pressure to make sense of many images and experiences.
gates.notes: This is the ‘big download’ gate. It floods the Ajna through Gate 47. Healthy 64 waits for the right moment; unhealthy 64 panics and overthinks.

gates.name: 61 — Inner Truth / Mystery
gates.pressure_theme: Pressure to know the unknowable, to find inner truth.
gates.notes: This is the mystical pressure. It doesn’t want data; it wants revelation. Not-self 61 tries to answer mystery with mind instead of waiting.

notes:
The Head is the *only* pressure center above the Throat. It doesn’t decide, act, or even truly ‘know’ — it *presses* the Ajna to think. Three inspiration streams start here:
1) **Logic**: 63 → 4 → 17 → 62 (pressure to doubt → answer → opinion → detail)
2) **Abstract**: 64 → 47 → 11 → 56 (pressure to resolve impressions → realization → ideas → storytelling)
3) **Individual**: 61 → 24 → 43 → 23 (pressure to know → rationalize → insight → express)

Key Jovian-style lines (< 25 words):
- “This center only provides mental pressure.”
- “You are *not* here to answer everybody’s questions.”
- “Inspiration is inconsistent and impersonal.”

Not-self Head: chasing *other people’s* questions, researching things that have nothing to do with your Strategy & Authority, feeling guilty for not ‘figuring it all out.’ Correct use: notice inspiration, let it pass through, and only engage the questions your Authority says yes to.
